results.definition: exerting shrewd or devious influence especially for one's own advantage

examples: use care when going down the stairs
use your common sense

results.definition: (economics) the utilization of economic goods to satisfy needs or in manufacturing

examples: he warned against the use of narcotic drugs
She uses drugs rarely
ballet is beautiful but what use is it?

results.definition: (psychology) an automatic pattern of behavior in reaction to a specific situation; may be inherited or acquired through frequent repetition
examples: long use had hardened him to it

results.definition: (law) the exercise of the legal right to enjoy the benefits of owning property
examples: we were given the use of his boat

results.definition: put into service; make work or employ for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose
examples: use your head!
we only use Spanish at home
I can't use this tool
use the plastic bags to store the food
He doesn't know how to use a computer
he put his knowledge to good use
patrons have their uses

results.definition: habitually do something or be in a certan state or place (use only in the past tense)
examples: She used to call her mother every week but now she calls only occasionally
I used to get sick when I ate in that dining hall
They used to vacation in the Bahamas
she used to be his best friend and now they are enemies

results.definition: seek or achieve an end by using to one's advantage
examples: She uses her influential friends to get jobs
The president's wife used her good connections
